intro: Acosta varnensis, commonly known as the Varnes' acosta, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs. Acosta varnensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cooler, moist conditions.
